architecture\n- Build scalable agent systems with proper monitoring\n- Deploy production-ready PydanticAI applications\n- Create enterprise integration patterns\n- Monitor and optimize agent performance\n\n---\n\n## Part 1: Dependency Injection & Architecture (25 minutes)\n\n### Dependency Injection for Testing and Production\n\nPydanticAI's dependency injection system enables clean separation between testing and production configurations, supporting eval-driven iterative development and robust production dependency management.\n\nüóÇÔ∏è **File**: `src/session5/dependency_injection.py` - Complete dependency injection system\n\n### Service Interface Protocols\n\nProtocols define the contracts that all service implementations must follow, enabling seamless switching between production and test implementations.\n\n```python\n# Essential imports for dependency injection\nfrom pydantic_ai.dependencies import DependencyProvider, Injectable, Scope\nfrom typing import Protocol, runtime_checkable\nfrom dataclasses import dataclass\nfrom contextlib import asynccontextmanager\nimport asyncio\nimport logging\n\n# Service interface definitions using Protocol pattern\n@runtime_checkable\nclass DatabaseService(Protocol):\n    \"\"\"Protocol for database operations with type safety.\"\"\"\n    async def save_result(self, result_data: Dict[str, Any]) -> str: ...\n    async def get_result(self, result_id: str) -> Optional[Dict[str, Any]]: ...\n    async def health_check(self) -> bool: ...\n\n@runtime_checkable  \nclass ExternalAPIService(Protocol):\n    \"\"\"Protocol for external API integrations.\"\"\"\n    async def fetch_data(self, query: str) -> Dict[str, Any]: ...\n    async def validate_source(self, source_url: str) -> bool: ...\n    \n@runtime_checkable\nclass CacheService(Protocol):\n    \"\"\"Protocol for caching operations with TTL support.\"\"\"\n    async def get(self, key: str) -> Optional[Any]: ...\n    async def set(self, key: str, value: Any, ttl: int = 3600) -> None: ...\n    async def invalidate(self, pattern: str) -> int: ...\n```\n\nThe `@runtime_checkable` decorator allows isinstance() checks at runtime, ensuring type safety in dependency injection.\n\n### Production Service Implementations\n\nProduction services provide real connectivity with proper error handling, connection pooling, and monitoring.\n\n```python\n# Production database implementation with connection pooling\nclass ProductionDatabaseService:\n    \"\"\"Production database service with connection pool management.\"\"\"\n    \n    def __init__(self, connection_string: str, pool_size: int = 10):\n        self.connection_string = connection_string\n        self.pool_size = pool_size\n        self._connection_pool = None\n    \n    async def initialize(self):\n        \"\"\"Initialize database connection pool for production use.\"\"\"\n        # In real implementation, this would create actual connection pool\n        self._connection_pool = f\"ConnectionPool({self.connection_string}, size={self.pool_size})\"\n        logging.info(f\"Database service initialized: {self._connection_pool}\")\n    \n    async def save_result(self, result_data: Dict[str, Any]) -> str:\n        \"\"\"Save agent result to production database with transaction safety.\"\"\"\n        # In production, this would use proper database transactions\n        result_id = str(uuid.uuid4())\n        logging.info(f\"Saved result {result_id} to database\")\n        return result_id\n    \n    async def get_result(self, result_id: str) -> Optional[Dict[str, Any]]:\n        \"\"\"Retrieve result from production database with error handling.\"\"\"\n        # Production implementation would include proper error handling\n        logging.info(f\"Retrieved result {result_id} from database\")\n        return {\"id\": result_id, \"status\": \"found\"}\n    \n    async def health_check(self) -> bool:\n        \"\"\"Monitor database connection health for production systems.\"\"\"\n        return self._connection_pool is not None\n```\n\n### Test Service Implementations\n\nTest implementations provide predictable behavior and call tracking for comprehensive testing without external dependencies.\n\n```python\n# Test database service with in-memory storage and call tracking\nclass TestDatabaseService:\n    \"\"\"Test database service with in-memory storage and comprehensive logging.\"\"\"\n    \n    def __init__(self):\n        self.data_store = {}  # In-memory storage for test data\n        self.call_log = []    # Track all method calls for verification\n    \n    async def initialize(self):\n        \"\"\"Initialize test database - always succeeds for testing.\"\"\"\n        logging.info(\"Test database service initialized\")\n    \n    async def save_result(self, result_data: Dict[str, Any]) -> str:\n        \"\"\"Save result to in-memory store with predictable IDs.\"\"\"\n        result_id = f\"test_{len(self.data_store)}\"\n        self.data_store[result_id] = result_data\n        self.call_log.append((\"save\", result_id, result_data))\n        return result_id\n    \n    async def get_result(self, result_id: str) -> Optional[Dict[str, Any]]:\n        \"\"\"Retrieve result from in-memory store with call logging.\"\"\"\n        self.call_log.append((\"get\", result_id))\n        return self.data_store.get(result_id)\n    \n    async def health_check(self) -> bool:\n        \"\"\"Test database is always healthy for consistent testing.\"\"\"\n        return True\n    \n    def get_call_log(self) -> List[tuple]:\n        \"\"\"Get complete log of service calls for test verification.\"\"\"\n        return self.call_log.copy()\n```\n\n### Dependency Injection Container\n\nThe dependency container manages service lifecycles, registration, and resolution with support for singletons and scoped services.\n\n```python\n# Advanced dependency injection container with lifecycle management\nclass DependencyContainer:\n    \"\"\"Enterprise-grade dependency injection container with full lifecycle support.\"\"\"\n    \n    def __init__(self):\n        self.services = {}              # Active service instances\n        self.factories = {}             # Service factory functions\n        self.singletons = {}           # Singleton service instances\n        self.scoped_services = {}      # Scoped service definitions\n        self.initialization_order = [] # Service initialization sequence\n    \n    def register_singleton(\n        self, \n        interface: Type, \n        implementation: Type, \n        *args, \n        **kwargs\n    ) -> None:\n        \"\"\"Register a singleton service that lives for the container lifetime.\"\"\"\n        self.factories[interface] = lambda: implementation(*args, **kwargs)\n        self.initialization_order.append(interface)\n    \n    async def get_service(self, interface: Type, scope: str = \"default\") -> Any:\n        \"\"\"Resolve service instance with proper initialization and lifecycle management.\"\"\"\n        \n        # Check existing singletons first for performance\n        if interface in self.singletons:\n            return self.singletons[interface]\n        \n        # Create and cache singleton instances\n        if interface in self.factories:\n            instance = self.factories[interface]()\n            if hasattr(instance, 'initialize'):\n                await instance.initialize()\n            self.singletons[interface] = instance\n            return instance\n        \n        raise ValueError(f\"No registration found for {interface}\")\n```\n\n---\n\n## Part 2: Scalability & Performance (25 minutes)\n\n### Production Agent Architecture\n\nüóÇÔ∏è **File**: `src/session5/production_agents.py` - Scalable agent implementations\n\nProduction PydanticAI applications require robust architecture patterns that handle concurrency, error recovery, and monitoring at scale.\n\n```python\n# Production-ready agent patterns and architectures\nimport asyncio\nfrom concurrent.futures import ThreadPoolExecutor\nfrom typing import Protocol, runtime_checkable\nfrom contextlib import asynccontextmanager\nimport logging\nfrom abc import ABC, abstractmethod\n\n# Configure production logging\nlogging.basicConfig(\n    level=logging.INFO,\n    format='%(asctime)s - %(name)s - %(levelname)s - %(message)s',\n    handlers=[\n        logging.StreamHandler(),\n        logging.FileHandler('agent_production.log')\n    ]\n)\n```\n\n### Agent Metrics and Monitoring\n\nComprehensive metrics tracking enables monitoring and optimization of agent performance in production environments.\n\n```python\nclass AgentMetrics(BaseModel):\n    \"\"\"Comprehensive agent metrics for monitoring.\"\"\"\n    \n    total_requests: int = 0\n    successful_requests: int = 0\n    failed_requests: int = 0\n    average_response_time_ms: float = 0.0\n    p95_response_time_ms: float = 0.0\n    p99_response_time_ms: float = 0.0\n    error_rate_percent: float = 0.0\n    last_request_timestamp: Optional[datetime] = None\n    uptime_seconds: float = 0.0\n    memory_usage_mb: float = 0.0\n    \n    @property\n    def success_rate_percent(self) -> float:\n        \"\"\"Calculate success rate percentage.\"\"\"\n        if self.total_requests == 0:\n            return 100.0\n        return (self.successful_requests / self.total_requests) * 100.0\n```\n\n### Production Agent Base Class\n\nThe production agent base class provides all necessary infrastructure for enterprise deployment including metrics, health checks, and error handling.\n\n```python\nclass ProductionAgentBase(ABC):\n    \"\"\"Abstract base class for production-ready agents.\"\"\"\n    \n    def __init__(self, name: str, config: Dict[str, Any] = None):\n        self.name = name\n        self.config = config or {}\n        self.logger = logging.getLogger(f\"{self.__class__.__name__}.{name}\")\n        self.metrics = AgentMetrics()\n        self.start_time = datetime.now(timezone.utc)\n        self._request_times: List[float] = []\n        self._executor = ThreadPoolExecutor(max_workers=4)\n        self._health_status = \"healthy\"\n        \n    @abstractmethod\n    async def _process_core_request(self, request: BaseModel) -> BaseModel:\n        \"\"\"Core request processing logic - must be implemented by subclasses.\"\"\"\n        pass\n```\n\n### Request Processing with Monitoring\n\nRequest processing includes comprehensive monitoring, error handling, and performance tracking for production reliability.\n\n```python\n    async def process_request(self, request: BaseModel) -> BaseModel:\n        \"\"\"Process request with full monitoring and error handling.\"\"\"\n        start_time = time.time()\n        self.metrics.total_requests += 1\n        \n        try:\n            # Update metrics\n            self.metrics.last_request_timestamp = datetime.now(timezone.utc)\n            \n            # Process the request\n            result = await self._process_core_request(request)\n            \n            # Track success\n            self.metrics.successful_requests += 1\n            self._health_status = \"healthy\"\n            \n            return result\n            \n        except Exception as e:\n            # Track failure\n            self.metrics.failed_requests += 1\n            self._health_status = \"degraded\"\n            self.logger.error(f\"Request processing failed: {e}\")\n            raise\n            \n        finally:\n            # Track timing\n            request_time = (time.time() - start_time) * 1000\n            self._request_times.append(request_time)\n            self._update_timing_metrics()\n```\n\n### Concurrent Request Processing\n\nProduction agents support concurrent request processing with proper resource management and backpressure handling.\n\n```python\n    async def process_batch(self, requests: List[BaseModel]) -> List[BaseModel]:\n        \"\"\"Process multiple requests concurrently with resource management.\"\"\"\n        \n        # Limit concurrent requests to prevent resource exhaustion\n        semaphore = asyncio.Semaphore(self.config.get('max_concurrent_requests', 10))\n        \n        async def process_with_semaphore(request):\n            async with semaphore:\n                return await self.process_request(request)\n        \n        # Execute all requests concurrently\n        tasks = [process_with_semaphore(req) for req in requests]\n        results = await asyncio.gather(*tasks, return_exceptions=True)\n        \n        # Separate successful results from exceptions\n        successful_results = []\n        for result in results:\n            if isinstance(result, Exception):\n                self.logger.error(f\"Batch processing error: {result}\")\n            else:\n                successful_results.append(result)\n        \n        return successful_results\n```\n\n### Health Monitoring and Circuit Breaker\n\nHealth monitoring and circuit breaker patterns prevent cascading failures in production environments.\n\n```python\n    async def health_check(self) -> Dict[str, Any]:\n        \"\"\"Comprehensive health check for monitoring systems.\"\"\"\n        uptime = (datetime.now(timezone.utc) - self.start_time).total_seconds()\n        self.metrics.uptime_seconds = uptime\n        \n        # Check memory usage\n        import psutil\n        process = psutil.Process()\n        memory_mb = process.memory_info().rss / 1024 / 1024\n        self.metrics.memory_usage_mb = memory_mb\n        \n        return {\n            \"status\": self._health_status,\n            \"uptime_seconds\": uptime,\n            \"memory_mb\": memory_mb,\n            \"success_rate\": self.metrics.success_rate_percent,\n            \"total_requests\": self.metrics.total_requests,\n            \"avg_response_time_ms\": self.metrics.average_response_time_ms\n        }\n```\n\n---\n\n## Part 3: Security & Compliance (20 minutes)\n\n### Enterprise Security Patterns\n\nüóÇÔ∏è **File**: `src/session5/security.py` - Enterprise security implementations\n\nEnterprise PydanticAI applications require comprehensive security patterns including authentication, authorization, data privacy, and audit logging.\n\n```python\n# Enterprise security patterns for PydanticAI\nimport jwt\nimport hashlib\nimport secrets\nfrom typing import List, Optional, Dict, Any\nfrom datetime import datetime, timedelta, timezone\nfrom pydantic import BaseModel, Field\nimport logging\n\nclass SecurityConfig(BaseModel):\n    \"\"\"Security configuration for enterprise deployments.\"\"\"\n    \n    jwt_secret_key: str = Field(..., min_length=32)\n    jwt_expiration_hours: int = Field(default=24, ge=1, le=168)  # 1 hour to 1 week\n    api_rate_limit_per_minute: int = Field(default=100, ge=1)\n    enable_audit_logging: bool = Field(default=True)\n    allowed_origins: List[str] = Field(default_factory=list)\n    require_https: bool = Field(default=True)\n```\n\n### Authentication and Authorization\n\nComprehensive authentication and authorization system for enterprise agent access control.\n\n```python\nclass UserRole(str, Enum):\n    \"\"\"User roles for role-based access control.\"\"\"\n    ADMIN = \"admin\"\n    AGENT_OPERATOR = \"agent_operator\"\n    DATA_ANALYST = \"data_analyst\"\n    READ_ONLY = \"read_only\"\n\nclass AuthenticationService:\n    \"\"\"Enterprise authentication service with JWT tokens.\"\"\"\n    \n    def __init__(self, config: SecurityConfig):\n        self.config = config\n        self.logger = logging.getLogger(__name__)\n    \n    def create_access_token(self, user_id: str, roles: List[UserRole]) -> str:\n        \"\"\"Create JWT access token with user information and roles.\"\"\"\n        now = datetime.now(timezone.utc)\n        payload = {\n            \"user_id\": user_id,\n            \"roles\": [role.value for role in roles],\n            \"iat\": now,\n            \"exp\": now + timedelta(hours=self.config.jwt_expiration_hours),\n            \"iss\": \"pydantic-ai-enterprise\"\n        }\n        \n        token = jwt.encode(payload, self.config.jwt_secret_key, algorithm=\"HS256\")\n        self.logger.info(f\"Created access token for user {user_id}\")\n        return token\n    \n    def verify_token(self, token: str) -> Optional[Dict[str, Any]]:\n        \"\"\"Verify JWT token and return user information.\"\"\"\n        try:\n            payload = jwt.decode(\n                token, \n                self.config.jwt_secret_key, \n                algorithms=[\"HS256\"],\n                options={\"verify_exp\": True}\n            )\n            return payload\n        except jwt.ExpiredSignatureError:\n            self.logger.warning(\"Token verification failed: expired\")\n            return None\n        except jwt.InvalidTokenError:\n            self.logger.warning(\"Token verification failed: invalid\")\n            return None\n```\n\n### Data Privacy and Compliance\n\nData privacy patterns ensure compliance with regulations like GDPR, HIPAA, and other enterprise requirements.\n\n```python\nclass DataPrivacyService:\n    \"\"\"Data privacy and compliance service for sensitive data handling.\"\"\"\n    \n    def __init__(self, encryption_key: str):\n        self.encryption_key = encryption_key.encode()\n        self.logger = logging.getLogger(__name__)\n    \n    def anonymize_user_data(self, data: Dict[str, Any]) -> Dict[str, Any]:\n        \"\"\"Anonymize sensitive user data while preserving utility.\"\"\"\n        anonymized = data.copy()\n        \n        # Hash personally identifiable information\n        if 'email' in anonymized:\n            anonymized['email_hash'] = self._hash_pii(anonymized.pop('email'))\n        \n        if 'user_id' in anonymized:\n            anonymized['user_hash'] = self._hash_pii(anonymized.pop('user_id'))\n        \n        # Remove sensitive fields\n        sensitive_fields = ['ssn', 'phone', 'address', 'credit_card']\n        for field in sensitive_fields:\n            if field in anonymized:\n                del anonymized[field]\n        \n        return anonymized\n    \n    def _hash_pii(self, data: str) -> str:\n        \"\"\"Hash personally identifiable information for anonymization.\"\"\"\n        # Use salt for additional security\n        salt = b\"pydantic_ai_salt\"\n        return hashlib.sha256(salt + data.encode()).hexdigest()[:16]\n```\n\n### Audit Logging System\n\nComprehensive audit logging tracks all agent operations for compliance and security monitoring.\n\n```python\nclass AuditLogger:\n    \"\"\"Enterprise audit logging for compliance and security monitoring.\"\"\"\n    \n    def __init__(self, config: SecurityConfig):\n        self.config = config\n        self.audit_logger = logging.getLogger(\"audit\")\n        \n        # Configure audit-specific handler\n        audit_handler = logging.FileHandler(\"audit.log\")\n        audit_formatter = logging.Formatter(\n            '%(asctime)s - AUDIT - %(levelname)s - %(message)s'\n        )\n        audit_handler.setFormatter(audit_formatter)\n        self.audit_logger.addHandler(audit_handler)\n        self.audit_logger.setLevel(logging.INFO)\n    \n    def log_agent_request(\n        self, \n        user_id: str, \n        agent_name: str, \n        request_data: Dict[str, Any],\n        result: Optional[Dict[str, Any]] = None,\n        error: Optional[str] = None\n    ):\n        \"\"\"Log agent request for audit trail.\"\"\"\n        if not self.config.enable_audit_logging:\n            return\n        \n        audit_entry = {\n            \"timestamp\": datetime.now(timezone.utc).isoformat(),\n            \"event_type\": \"agent_request\",\n            \"user_id\": user_id,\n            \"agent_name\": agent_name,\n            \"request_size_bytes\": len(str(request_data)),\n            \"success\": error is None,\n            \"error_message\": error\n        }\n        \n        self.audit_logger.info(f\"AGENT_REQUEST: {audit_entry}\")\n```\n\n---\n\n## üéØ Module Summary\n\nYou've now mastered enterprise PydanticAI patterns, including:\n\n‚úÖ **Dependency Injection**: Built clean, testable architecture with service protocols  \n‚úÖ **Production Scalability**: Implemented monitoring, metrics, and concurrent processing  \n‚úÖ **Enterprise Security**: Created authentication, authorization, and compliance systems  \n‚úÖ **Audit & Monitoring**: Built comprehensive logging and health monitoring\n\n### Next Steps\n- **Continue to Module C**: [Custom Validation Systems](Session5_ModuleC_Custom_Validation_Systems.md) for specialized validation patterns\n- **Continue to Module D**: [Testing & Benchmarking](Session5_ModuleD_Testing_Benchmarking.md) for comprehensive testing strategies\n- **Return to Core**: [Session 5 Main](Session5_PydanticAI_Type_Safe_Agents.md)\n- **Advance to Session 6**: [Atomic Agents](Session6_Atomic_Agents_Modular_Architecture.md)\n\n---\n\n**üóÇÔ∏è Source Files for Module B:**\n- `src/session5/dependency_injection.py` - Complete DI system\n- }

 EXTERNAL_SERVICE = \"external_service\"\n    DATA_CORRUPTION = \"data_corruption\"\n    CONFIGURATION = \"configuration\"\n    UNKNOWN = \"unknown\"\n```\n\n### Comprehensive Error Context\n\nThe \"\"\"Comprehensive error context for debugging and monitoring.\"\"\"\n    error_id: str = field(default_factory=lambda: str(uuid.uuid4()))\n    timestamp: datetime = field(default_factory=lambda: traceback.format_exc()\n        self.__cause__ = cause\n\nclass ValidationAgentError(AgentError):\n    \"\"\"Error specific to validation failures.\"\"\"\n    \n    def __init__(self, message: str, details={'field': field, 'invalid_value': value}\n        )\n        super().__init__(message, context, **kwargs)\n\nclass NetworkAgentError(AgentError):\n    \"\"\"Error specific to network operations.\"\"\"\n    \n    def __init__(self, message: str, endpoint: str = None, status_code: int = None, **kwargs):\n        context = ErrorContext(\n            category=ErrorCategory.NETWORK,\n            severity=ErrorSeverity.HIGH,\n            details={'endpoint': endpoint, 'status_code': status_code}\n        )\n        super().__init__(message, context, **kwargs)\n```\n\n### Error Classification Engine\n\nThe error classifier analyzes exception types and error messages to automatically categorize errors for appropriate handling strategies.\n\n```python\nclass ErrorClassifier:\n    \"\"\"Classifies and categorizes errors for appropriate handling.\"\"\"\n    \n    def __init__(self):\n        self.classification_rules = {\n            # Validation errors\n            (ValueError, TypeError): (ErrorCategory.VALIDATION, ErrorSeverity.MEDIUM),\n            (ValidationError,): (ErrorCategory.VALIDATION, ErrorSeverity.MEDIUM),\n            \n            # Network errors\n            (ConnectionError, ConnectionRefusedError, ConnectionResetError): (ErrorCategory.NETWORK, ErrorSeverity.HIGH),\n            (TimeoutError, asyncio.TimeoutError): (ErrorCategory.TIMEOUT, ErrorSeverity.HIGH),\n            \n            # Resource errors\n            (MemoryError,): (ErrorCategory.RESOURCE_EXHAUSTION, ErrorSeverity.CRITICAL),\n            (OSError,): (ErrorCategory.CONFIGURATION, ErrorSeverity.HIGH),\n            \n            # Permission errors  \n            (PermissionError,): (ErrorCategory.PERMISSION, ErrorSeverity.HIGH),\n        }\n    \n    def classify_error(self, error: Exception) -> tuple[ErrorCategory, ErrorSeverity]:\n        \"\"\"Classify an error into category and severity.\"\"\"\n        \n        error_type = type(error)\n        \n        # Check direct matches first\n        for error_types, (category, severity) in self.classification_rules.items():\n            if error_type in error_types:\n                return category, severity\n        \n        # Analyze error message for additional clues\n        error_message = str(error).lower()\n        \n        if any(word in error_message for word in ['timeout', 'deadline', 'expired']):\n            return ErrorCategory.TIMEOUT, ErrorSeverity.HIGH\n        elif any(word in error_message for word in ['network', 'connection', 'socket']):\n            return ErrorCategory.NETWORK, ErrorSeverity.HIGH\n        elif any(word in error_message for word in ['rate limit', 'throttle', 'quota']):\n            return ErrorCategory.RATE_LIMIT, ErrorSeverity.MEDIUM\n        \n        return ErrorCategory.UNKNOWN, ErrorSeverity.MEDIUM\n```\n\n---\n\n## Part 2: Intelligent Retry Strategies (15 minutes)\n\n### Retry Strategy Configuration\n\nüóÇÔ∏è **File**: `src/session5/retry_strategies.py` - Intelligent retry implementations\n\nIntelligent retry strategies prevent cascade failures and provide resilient error recovery patterns essential for production agent systems.\n\n```python\nclass RetryStrategy:\n    \"\"\"Configurable retry strategies for error recovery.\"\"\"\n    \n    def __init__(self, max_retries: int = 3, base_delay: float = 1.0, backoff_multiplier: float = 2.0):\n        self.max_retries = max_retries\n        self.base_delay = base_delay\n        self.backoff_multiplier = backoff_multiplier\n        self.retryable_categories = {\n            ErrorCategory.NETWORK,\n            ErrorCategory.TIMEOUT,\n            ErrorCategory.RATE_LIMIT,\n            ErrorCategory.EXTERNAL_SERVICE\n        }\n    \n    def should_retry(self, error_context: ErrorContext) -> bool:\n        \"\"\"Determine if error should be retried.\"\"\"\n        \n        if error_context.retry_count >= self.max_retries:\n            return False\n        \n        if not error_context.recoverable:\n            return False\n        \n        if error_context.severity == ErrorSeverity.CRITICAL:\n            return False\n        \n        return error_context.category in self.retryable_categories\n    \n    def calculate_delay(self, retry_count: int) -> float:\n        \"\"\"Calculate delay before next retry attempt using exponential backoff.\"\"\"\n        return self.base_delay * (self.backoff_multiplier ** retry_count)\n```\n\n### Retry Execution Framework\n\nThe core retry execution engine attempts function calls, classifies errors, makes retry decisions, and implements backoff delays for resilient agent operations.\n\n```python\n    async def execute_with_retry(\n        self, \n        func: Callable[..., Awaitable[T]], \n        *args, \n        **kwargs\n    ) -> T:\n        \"\"\"Execute function with retry logic.\"\"\"\n        \n        last_error = None\n        \n        for attempt in range(self.max_retries + 1):\n            try:\n                return await func(*args, **kwargs)\n                \n            except Exception as e:\n                classifier = ErrorClassifier()\n                category, severity = classifier.classify_error(e)\n                \n                error_context = ErrorContext(\n                    category=category,\n                    severity=severity,\n                    message=str(e),\n                    retry_count=attempt,\n                    max_retries=self.max_retries\n                )\n                \n                last_error = AgentError(str(e), error_context, e)\n                \n                if not self.should_retry(error_context):\n                    break\n                \n                if attempt < self.max_retries:\n                    delay = self.calculate_delay(attempt)\n                    logging.info(f\"Retrying after {delay}s (attempt {attempt + 1}/{self.max_retries + 1})\")\n                    await asyncio.sleep(delay)\n        \n        if last_error:\n            raise last_error\n        \n        raise AgentError(\"Maximum retries exceeded\")\n```\n\n### Error Handler Decorator\n\nThis decorator provides a clean interface for applying error handling and retry strategies to any agent function with declarative configuration.\n\n```python\ndef error_handler(\n    category: ErrorCategory = ErrorCategory.UNKNOWN,\n    severity: ErrorSeverity = ErrorSeverity.MEDIUM,\n    retry_strategy: RetryStrategy = None,\n    user_message: str = None\n):\n    \"\"\"Decorator for comprehensive error handling.\"\"\"\n    \n    def decorator(func: Callable[..., Awaitable[T]]) -> Callable[..., Awaitable[T]]:\n        @wraps(func)\n        async def wrapper(*args, **kwargs) -> T:\n            try:\n                if retry_strategy:\n                    return await retry_strategy.execute_with_retry(func, *args, **kwargs)\n                else:\n                    return await func(*args, **kwargs)\n                    \n            except AgentError:\n                # Re-raise AgentErrors with their existing context\n                raise\n                \n            except Exception as e:\n                # Wrap other exceptions in AgentError\n                classifier = ErrorClassifier()\n                error_category, error_severity = classifier.classify_error(e)\n                \n                context = ErrorContext(\n                    category=error_category if error_category != ErrorCategory.UNKNOWN else category,\n                    severity=error_severity if error_severity != ErrorSeverity.MEDIUM else severity,\n                    message=str(e),\n                    user_facing_message=user_message or \"An error occurred while processing your request\"\n                )\n                \n                raise AgentError(str(e), context, e)\n        \n        return wrapper\n    return decorator\n```\n\n---\n\n## Part 3: Circuit Breaker Pattern (15 minutes)\n\n### Circuit Breaker Implementation\n\nüóÇÔ∏è **File**: `src/session5/circuit_breaker.py` - Circuit breaker for service resilience\n\nCircuit breaker state management prevents cascade failures by isolating failing services and providing automatic recovery mechanisms.\n\n```python\nclass CircuitBreakerState(Enum):\n    \"\"\"Circuit breaker states.\"\"\"\n    CLOSED = \"closed\"       # Normal operation\n    OPEN = \"open\"           # Failing, requests blocked\n    HALF_OPEN = \"half_open\" # Testing if service recovered\n\n@dataclass\nclass CircuitBreakerConfig:\n    \"\"\"Configuration for circuit breaker.\"\"\"\n    failure_threshold: int = 5\n    recovery_timeout_seconds: float = 60.0\n    success_threshold: int = 3\n    timeout_seconds: float = 30.0\n\nclass CircuitBreaker:\n    \"\"\"Circuit breaker implementation for resilient external service calls.\"\"\"\n    \n    def __init__(self, name: str, config: CircuitBreakerConfig = None):\n        self.name = name\n        self.config = config or CircuitBreakerConfig()\n        self.state = CircuitBreakerState.CLOSED\n        self.failure_count = 0\n        self.success_count = 0\n        self.last_failure_time: Optional[datetime] = None\n        self.logger = logging.getLogger(f\"CircuitBreaker.{name}\")\n```\n\n### Protected Function Execution\n\nThe core circuit breaker protection logic blocks calls when the circuit is open and manages state transitions during recovery attempts.\n\n```python\n    async def call(self, func: Callable[..., Awaitable[T]], *args, **kwargs) -> T:\n        \"\"\"Execute function call with circuit breaker protection.\"\"\"\n        \n        if self.state == CircuitBreakerState.OPEN:\n            if self._should_attempt_reset():\n                self.state = CircuitBreakerState.HALF_OPEN\n                self.logger.info(f\"Circuit breaker {self.name} transitioning to HALF_OPEN\")\n            else:\n                raise AgentError(\n                    f\"Circuit breaker {self.name} is OPEN\",\n                    ErrorContext(\n                        category=ErrorCategory.EXTERNAL_SERVICE,\n                        severity=ErrorSeverity.HIGH,\n                        message=\"Service unavailable due to repeated failures\"\n                    )\n                )\n        \n        try:\n            result = await asyncio.wait_for(\n                func(*args, **kwargs),\n                timeout=self.config.timeout_seconds\n            )\n            \n            await self._on_success()\n            return result\n            \n        except Exception as e:\n            await self._on_failure()\n            raise\n```\n\n### Intelligent State Management\n\nAutomatic state management ensures services can recover gracefully while protecting against premature recovery attempts that could overwhelm failing services.\n\n```python\n    def _should_attempt_reset(self) -> bool:\n        \"\"\"Check if circuit breaker should attempt to reset.\"\"\"\n        if not self.last_failure_time:\n            return True\n        \n        time_since_failure = datetime.now(timezone.utc) - self.last_failure_time\n        return time_since_failure.total_seconds() >= self.config.recovery_timeout_seconds\n    \n    async def _on_success(self) -> None:\n        \"\"\"Handle successful call.\"\"\"\n        self.failure_count = 0\n        \n        if self.state == CircuitBreakerState.HALF_OPEN:\n            self.success_count += 1\n            \n            if self.success_count >= self.config.success_threshold:\n                self.state = CircuitBreakerState.CLOSED\n                self.success_count = 0\n                self.logger.info(f\"Circuit breaker {self.name} CLOSED after successful recovery\")\n    \n    async def _on_failure(self) -> None:\n        \"\"\"Handle failed call.\"\"\"\n        self.failure_count += 1\n        self.last_failure_time = datetime.now(timezone.utc)\n        \n        if self.state == CircuitBreakerState.HALF_OPEN:\n            self.state = CircuitBreakerState.OPEN\n            self.success_count = 0\n            self.logger.warning(f\"Circuit breaker {self.name} OPEN after failure during recovery\")\n        \n        elif self.failure_count >= self.config.failure_threshold:\n            self.state = CircuitBreakerState.OPEN\n            self.logger.warning(f\"Circuit breaker {self.name} OPEN after {self.failure_count} failures\")\n```\n\n### External Service Integration\n\nA consistent base class ensures all external service integrations follow the same resilience patterns and monitoring standards.\n\n```python\n# Integration patterns for external services\nclass ExternalServiceIntegration:\n    \"\"\"Base class for external service integrations with comprehensive error handling.\"\"\"\n    \n    def __init__(self, service_name: str, base_url: str, circuit_breaker_config: CircuitBreakerConfig = None):\n        self.service_name = service_name\n        self.base_url = base_url\n        self.circuit_breaker = CircuitBreaker(service_name, circuit_breaker_config)\n        self.retry_strategy = RetryStrategy(max_retries=3, base_delay=1.0)\n        self.logger = logging.getLogger(f\"Integration.{service_name}\")\n    \n    @error_handler(\n        category=ErrorCategory.EXTERNAL_SERVICE,\n        severity=ErrorSeverity.HIGH,\n        user_message=\"External service temporarily unavailable\"\n    )\n    async def make_request(\n        self,\n        endpoint: str,\n        method: str = \"GET\",\n        data: Dict[str, Any] = None,\n        headers: Dict[str, str] = None\n    ) -> Dict[str, Any]:\n        \"\"\"Make HTTP request with comprehensive error handling.\"\"\"\n        \n        async def _make_http_request():\n            url = f\"{self.base_url}/{endpoint.lstrip('/')}\"\n            \n            # Simulate various failure scenarios for testing\n            import random\n            if random.random() < 0.1:  # 10% chance of failure\n                raise NetworkAgentError(\n                    \"Simulated network error\",\n                    endpoint=url,\n                    status_code=503\n                )\n            \n            # Simulate successful response\n            return {\n                'success': True,\n                'data': {'message': f'Success from {self.service_name}', 'endpoint': endpoint},\n                'status_code': 200,\n                'timestamp': datetime.now(timezone.utc).isoformat()\n            }\n        \n        return await self.circuit_breaker.call(_make_http_request)\n```\n\n---\n\n## üéØ Module Summary\n\nYou've now mastered custom validation systems and resilient error handling, including:\n\n‚úÖ **Comprehensive Intelligent Cache Implementation\n\nThe intelligent cache provides high-performance caching with automatic eviction, memory management, and comprehensive statistics.\n\n```python\nclass IntelligentCache(Generic[K, V]):\n    \"\"\"High-performance cache with intelligent eviction strategies.\"\"\"\n    \n    def __init__(\n        self, \n        max_size: int = 1000,\n        default_ttl_seconds: float = 3600,\n        max_memory_mb: float = 100\n    ):\n        self.max_size = max_size\n        self.default_ttl_seconds = default_ttl_seconds\n        self.max_memory_bytes = max_memory_mb * 1024 * 1024\n        \n        self._cache: OrderedDict[K, CacheEntry[V]] = OrderedDict()\n        self._lock = threading.RLock()\n        self._total_size_bytes = 0\n        self._stats = {\n            'hits': 0,\n            'misses': 0,\n            'evictions': 0,\n            'expired_cleanups': 0\n        }\n    \n    def get(self, key: K) -> Optional[V]:\n        \"\"\"Get value from cache with intelligent access tracking.\"\"\"\n        with self._lock:\n            # Periodic cleanup\n            if len(self._cache) > 100 and len(self._cache) % 50 == 0:\n                self._cleanup_expired()\n            \n            entry = self._cache.get(key)\n            if not entry:\n                self._stats['misses'] += 1\n                return None\n            \n            if entry.is_expired():\n                self._cache.pop(key)\n                self._total_size_bytes -= entry.size_bytes\n                self._stats['misses'] += 1\n                self._stats['expired_cleanups'] += 1\n                return None\n            \n            # Update access statistics and move to end (most recently used)\n            entry.update_access()\n            self._cache.move_to_end(key)\n            self._stats['hits'] += 1\n            \n            return entry.value\n    \n    def set(self, key: K, value: V, ttl_seconds: float = None) -> None:\n        \"\"\"Set value in cache with intelligent eviction.\"\"\"\n        with self._lock:\n            ttl = ttl_seconds or self.default_ttl_seconds\n            size_bytes = self._calculate_size(value)\n            \n            # Remove existing entry if present\n            if key in self._cache:\n                old_entry = self._cache.pop(key)\n                self._total_size_bytes -= old_entry.size_bytes\n            \n            # Create new entry\n            entry = CacheEntry(\n                value=value,\n                created_at=datetime.now(timezone.utc),\n                last_accessed=datetime.now(timezone.utc),\n                access_count=1,\n                ttl_seconds=ttl,\n                size_bytes=size_bytes\n            )\n            \n            # Evict if necessary before adding\n            self._evict_lru()\n            \n            # Add new entry\n            self._cache[key] = entry\n            self._total_size_bytes += size_bytes\n    \n    def _calculate_size(self, obj: Any) -> int:\n        \"\"\"Estimate object size in bytes for memory management.\"\"\"\n        try:\n            return len(json.dumps(obj, default=str).encode('utf-8'))\n        except:\n            # Fallback estimation\n            return len(str(obj)) * 2  # Rough estimate for Unicode\n    \n    def _evict_lru(self) -> None:\n        \"\"\"Evict least recently used entries when limits are exceeded.\"\"\"\n        while len(self._cache) >= self.max_size or self._total_size_bytes >= self.max_memory_bytes:\n            if not self._cache:\n                break\n            \n            key, entry = self._cache.popitem(last=False)  # Remove oldest (LRU)\n            self._total_size_bytes -= entry.size_bytes\n            self._stats['evictions'] += 1\n    \n    def get_stats(self) -> Dict[str, Any]:\n        \"\"\"Get comprehensive cache performance statistics.\"\"\"\n        with self._lock:\n            total_requests = self._stats['hits'] + self._stats['misses']\n            hit_rate = (self._stats['hits'] / total_requests * 100) if total_requests > 0 else 0\n            \n            return {\n                'size': len(self._cache),\n                'max_size': self.max_size,\n                'memory_usage_mb': self._total_size_bytes / (1024 * 1024),\n                'hit_rate_percent': hit_rate,\n                'total_requests': total_requests,\n                'stats': dict(self._stats)\n            }\n```\n\n### Cache Decorator for Agent Methods\n\nA convenient decorator enables automatic caching of agent method results with configurable TTL and cache key generation.\n\n```python\ndef cached_agent_method(\n    cache: IntelligentCache,\n    ttl_seconds: float = 3600,\n    key_generator: Optional[Callable] = None\n):\n    \"\"\"Decorator for caching agent method results.\"\"\"\n    \n    def decorator(func: Callable) -> Callable:\n        @wraps(func)\n        async def wrapper(*args, **kwargs):\n            # Generate cache key\n            if key_generator:\n                cache_key = key_generator(*args, **kwargs)\n            else:\n                key_data = f\"{func.__name__}:{hash(str(args) + str(sorted(kwargs.items())))}\"\n                cache_key = hashlib.md5(key_data.encode()).hexdigest()\n            \n            # Try to get from cache\n            cached_result = cache.get(cache_key)\n            if cached_result is not None:\n     \n            return result\n        \n        return wrapper\n    return decorator\n```\n\n---\n\n## üéØ Module Summary\n\nYou've now mastered testing and benchmarking for PydanticAI, It demonstrates how to handle complex data structures with custom validation logic.\n\n```python\n    @validator('skills')\n    def validate_skills_list(cls, v):\n        \"\"\"Validate skills list for quality and uniqueness.\"\"\"\n        if not v:\n            return v\n        \n        # Remove duplicates while preserving order\n        seen = set()\n        unique_skills = []\n        for skill in v:\n            skill_normalized = skill.strip().lower()\n            if skill_normalized not in seen and len(skill_normalized) >= 2:\n                seen.add(skill_normalized)\n                unique_skills.append(skill.strip())\n        \n        # Validate skill format\n        for skill in unique_skills:\n            if not re.match(r'^[a-zA-Z0-9\\s\\+\\#\\-\\.]+$', skill):\n                raise ValueError(f'Invalid skill format: {skill}')\n        \n        return unique_skills\n```\n\n### Contextual Validation Using Other Fields\n\nThis validator demonstrates how to validate a field based on values from other fields. Core identification fields with length constraints\n    task_id: str = Field(..., min_length=8, max_length=32)\n    title: str = Field(..., min_length=5, max_length=200)\n    description: str = Field(..., min_length=10, max_length=2000)\n    \n    # Status and assignment management\n    priority: TaskPriority\n    status: TaskStatus = TaskStatus.PENDING\n    assignee_id: Optional[str] = None\n    reporter_id: str = Field(..., min_length=3)\n    \n    # Metadata and organizational fields\n    labels: List[str] = Field(default_factory=list, max_items=10)\n    estimated_hours: Optional[float] = Field(None, gt=0, le=1000)\n    due_date: Optional[datetime] = None\n    dependencies: List[str] = Field(default_factory=list, max_items=20)\n    created_at: datetime = Field(default_factory=lambda: datetime.now(timezone.utc))\n    updated_at: datetime = Field(default_factory=lambda: datetime.now(timezone.utc))\n```\n\n### Task ID Format Validation\n\nTask ID validation ensures consistent organizational formatting across all tasks using regex patterns that enforce specific business requirements.\n\n```python\n    @validator('task_id')\n    def validate_task_id_format(cls, v):\n        \"\"\"Enforce organizational task ID format for consistency.\"\"\"\n        # Required format: PROJECT-NUMBER (e.g., PROJ-1234, AI-5678)\n        if not re.match(r'^[A-Z]{2,10}-\\d{1,6}$', v):\n            raise ValueError('Task ID must follow format: PROJECT-NUMBER (e.g., PROJ-1234)')\n        return v\n```\n\n### Title Quality Validation\n\nTitle validation prevents common quality issues like overly generic or poorly formatted titles, ensuring better task clarity and searchability.\n\n```python\n    @validator('title')\n    def validate_title_quality(cls, v):\n        \"\"\"Enforce title quality standards to improve task clarity.\"\"\"\n        # Normalize whitespace\n        cleaned_title = ' '.join(v.split())\n        \n        # Detect and reject poor title patterns\n        poor_patterns = [\n            r'^(fix|bug|issue|problem|error)\\s*$',  # Too generic\n            r'^(do|make|create|update)\\s*$',        # Too vague\n            r'^[a-z]',                              # Should start with capital\n            r'\\s+$',                                # Ends with whitespace\n        ]\n        \n        for pattern in poor_patterns:\n            if re.search(pattern, cleaned_title, re.IGNORECASE):\n                raise ValueError(f'Title fails quality check: {cleaned_title}')\n        \n        return cleaned_title\n```\n\n### Due Date and Work Estimation Correlation\n\nDue date validation includes sophisticated cross-field validation with work estimation correlation, preventing unrealistic work schedules.\n\n```python\n    @validator('due_date')\n    def validate_due_date_reasonable(cls, v, values):\n        \"\"\"Comprehensive due date validation with business logic.\"\"\"\n        if v is None:\n            return v\n        \n        now = datetime.now(timezone.utc)\n        \n        # Prevent past due dates\n        if v < now:\n            raise ValueError('Due date cannot be in the past')\n        \n        # Reasonable future limit (2 years)\n        max_future_date = now.replace(year=now.year + 2)\n        if v > max_future_date:\n            raise ValueError('Due date too far in the future (max 2 years)')\n        \n        # Cross-validate with estimated work hours\n        estimated_hours = values.get('estimated_hours')\n        if estimated_hours:\n            time_until_due = (v - now).days\n            hours_per_day = estimated_hours / max(time_until_due, 1)\n            \n            # Prevent unrealistic work schedules (max 16 hours per day)\n            if hours_per_day > 16:\n                raise ValueError('Due date too soon for estimated work hours')\n        \n        return v\n```\n\n---\n\n## Part 3: Advanced Error Handling & Middleware (15 minutes)\n\n### Comprehensive Validation Error Management\n\nüóÇÔ∏è **File**: `src/session5/error_handling.py` - Advanced error handling and middleware systems\n\nThis section demonstrates enterprise-grade error handling with detailed feedback, analytics, and suggestion systems.\n\n```python\n# Advanced validation error management system\nfrom typing import Dict, List, Type, Any\nimport traceback\nfrom dataclasses import dataclass\n\n@dataclass\nclass ValidationErrorDetail:\n    \"\"\"Comprehensive validation error details with suggestions.\"\"\"\n    field_path: str       # Path to the field that failed (e.g., 'task.title')\n    error_type: str       # Type of validation error\n    message: str          # Human-readable error message\n    invalid_value: Any    # The value that caused the error\n    constraint: str       # The constraint that was violated\n    suggestion: Optional[str] = None  # Suggested fix for the error\n```\n\n### Validation Error Handler with Analytics\n\nThe error handler tracks error patterns to identify common validation issues and provides intelligent suggestions for fixes.\n\n```python\nclass ValidationErrorHandler:\n    \"\"\"Advanced validation error handling with analytics and suggestions.\"\"\"\n    \n    def __init__(self):\n        self.error_counts: Dict[str, int] = {}  # Track error frequency\n        self.common_errors: List[ValidationErrorDetail] = []  # Common error patterns\n    \n    def handle_validation_error(self, error: Exception, model_class: Type[BaseModel]) -> Dict[str, Any]:\n        \"\"\"Transform raw validation errors into structured, actionable feedback.\"\"\"\n        \n        error_details = []\n        \n        # Process Pydantic validation errors\n        if hasattr(error, 'errors'):\n            for err in error.errors():\n                detail = ValidationErrorDetail(\n                    field_path='.'.join(str(loc) for loc in err['loc']),\n                    error_type=err['type'],\n                    message=err['msg'],\n                    invalid_value=err.get('ctx', {}).get('given', 'unknown'),\n                    constraint=err.get('ctx', {}).get('limit_value', 'unknown'),\n                    suggestion=self._generate_suggestion(err['type'], err['msg'])\n                )\n                error_details.append(detail)\n                \n                # Track error frequency for analytics\n                error_key = f\"{model_class.__name__}.{detail.field_path}.{detail.error_type}\"\n                self.error_counts[error_key] = self.error_counts.get(error_key, 0) + 1\n        \n        # Generate comprehensive error response\n        return {\n            'validation_failed': True,\n            'model': model_class.__name__,\n            'error_count': len(error_details),\n            'errors': [\n                {\n                    'field': detail.field_path,\n                    'type': detail.error_type,\n                    'message': detail.message,\n                    'invalid_value': detail.invalid_value,\n                    'suggestion': detail.suggestion\n                }\n                for detail in error_details\n            ],\n            'timestamp': datetime.now(timezone.utc).isoformat()\n        }\n```\n\n### Intelligent Suggestion Generation\n\nThis method provides contextual suggestions based on error types and messages, improving user experience by providing specific guidance on how to fix validation errors.\n\n```python\n    def _generate_suggestion(self, error_type: str, message: str) -> Optional[str]:\n        \"\"\"Generate helpful suggestions based on error type.\"\"\"\n        \n        suggestions = {\n            'value_error': {\n                'email': 'Please provide a valid email address (e.g., user@example.com)',\n                'url': 'Please provide a valid URL starting with http:// or https://',\n                'regex': 'Please check the format requirements for this field',\n            },\n            'type_error': {\n                'str': 'This field requires text (string) input',\n                'int': 'This field requires a whole number',\n                'float': 'This field requires a decimal number',\n                'list': 'This field requires a list of values',\n                'dict': 'This field requires a dictionary/object structure',\n            },\n            'missing': {\n                'default': 'This field is required and cannot be empty'\n            }\n        }\n        \n        # Extract error category and provide suggestion\n        for category, subcategories in suggestions.items():\n            if category in error_type:\n                for keyword, suggestion in subcategories.items():\n                    if keyword in message.lower() or keyword == 'default':\n                        return suggestion\n        \n        return None\n```\n\n### Validation Middleware with Caching\n\nThis middleware architecture enables consistent validation behavior across all agents while providing performance optimizations through caching and centralized error handling.\n\n```python\nclass ValidationMiddleware:\n    \"\"\"Middleware for comprehensive validation in agent workflows.\"\"\"\n    \n    def __init__(self):\n        self.error_handler = ValidationErrorHandler()\n        self.validation_cache: Dict[str, bool] = {}\n    \n    async def validate_input(self, data: Any, model_class: Type[BaseModel]) -> Dict[str, Any]:\n        \"\"\"Validate input data with caching and error handling.\"\"\"\n        \n        # Generate cache key\n        cache_key = f\"{model_class.__name__}:{hash(str(data))}\"\n        \n        if cache_key in self.validation_cache:\n            return {'valid': True, 'cached': True}\n        \n        try:\n            # Attempt validation\n            validated_instance = model_class(**data if isinstance(data, dict) else data.__dict__)\n            \n            # Cache successful validation\n            self.validation_cache[cache_key] = True\n            \n            return {\n                'valid': True,\n                'data': validated_instance.dict(),\n                'model': model_class.__name__,\n                'cached': False\n            }\n            \n        except Exception as e:\n            # Handle validation failure\n            error_report = self.error_handler.handle_validation_error(e, model_class)\n            \n            return {\n                'valid': False,\n                'error_report': error_report,\n                'cached': False\n            }\n```\n\n---\n\n## üéØ Module Summary\n\nYou've now mastered advanced type systems in PydanticAI, including:\n\n‚úÖ **Complex Validation Patterns**: Built sophisticated cross-field validation with business logic  \n‚úÖ **Enterprise Task Management**: Implemented real-world validation for complex business entities  \n‚úÖ **Advanced Error Handling**: Created intelligent error reporting with suggestions and analytics  \n‚úÖ **Validation Middleware**: Built performance-optimized validation systems with caching\n\n### Next Steps\n- **Continue to Module B**: [Enterprise PydanticAI](Session5_ModuleB_Enterprise_PydanticAI.md) for production deployment patterns\n- **Return to Core**: [Session 5 Main](Session5_PydanticAI_Type_Safe_Agents.md) \n- **Advance to Session 6**: [Atomic Agents](Session6_Atomic_Agents_Modular_Architecture.md)\n\n---\n\n**üóÇÔ∏è Source Files for Module A:**\n- `src/session5/advanced_validation.py` - Complex validation patterns\n- `src/session5/enterprise_validation.py` - Enterprise task validation\n- `src/session5/error_handling.py` - Advanced error handling systems"

  "content": "# Session 5 - Module B: Enterprise PydanticAI (70 minutes)\n\n**Prerequisites**: [Session 5 Core Section Complete](Session5_PydanticAI_Type_Safe_Agents.md)  \n**Target Audience**: Production system builders  \n**Cognitive Load**: 7 production concepts\n\n---\n\n## üéØ Module Overview\n\nThis module focuses on enterprise-grade PydanticAI deployment patterns, including dependency injection, scalable architectures, monitoring, and production deployment strategies. architecture\n- Build scalable agent systems with proper monitoring\n- Deploy production-ready PydanticAI applications\n- Create enterprise integration patterns\n- Monitor and optimize agent performance\n\n---\n\n## Part 1: Dependency Injection & Architecture (25 minutes)\n\n### Dependency Injection for Testing and Production\n\nPydanticAI's dependency injection system enables clean separation between testing and production configurations, supporting eval-driven iterative development and robust production dependency management.\n\nüóÇÔ∏è **File**: `src/session5/dependency_injection.py` - Complete dependency injection system\n\n### Service Interface Protocols\n\nProtocols define the contracts that all service implementations must follow, enabling seamless switching between production and test implementations.\n\n```python\n# Essential imports for dependency injection\nfrom pydantic_ai.dependencies import DependencyProvider, Injectable, Scope\nfrom typing import Protocol, runtime_checkable\nfrom dataclasses import dataclass\nfrom contextlib import asynccontextmanager\nimport asyncio\nimport logging\n\n# Service interface definitions using Protocol pattern\n@runtime_checkable\nclass DatabaseService(Protocol):\n    \"\"\"Protocol for database operations with type safety.\"\"\"\n    async def save_result(self, result_data: Dict[str, Any]) -> str: ...\n    async def get_result(self, result_id: str) -> Optional[Dict[str, Any]]: ...\n    async def health_check(self) -> bool: ...\n\n@runtime_checkable  \nclass ExternalAPIService(Protocol):\n    \"\"\"Protocol for external API integrations.\"\"\"\n    async def fetch_data(self, query: str) -> Dict[str, Any]: ...\n    async def validate_source(self, source_url: str) -> bool: ...\n    \n@runtime_checkable\nclass CacheService(Protocol):\n    \"\"\"Protocol for caching operations with TTL support.\"\"\"\n    async def get(self, key: str) -> Optional[Any]: ...\n    async def set(self, key: str, value: Any, ttl: int = 3600) -> None: ...\n    async def invalidate(self, pattern: str) -> int: ...\n```\n\nThe `@runtime_checkable` decorator allows isinstance() checks at runtime, ensuring type safety in dependency injection.\n\n### Production Service Implementations\n\nProduction services provide real connectivity with proper error handling, connection pooling, and monitoring.\n\n```python\n# Production database implementation with connection pooling\nclass ProductionDatabaseService:\n    \"\"\"Production database service with connection pool management.\"\"\"\n    \n    def __init__(self, connection_string: str, pool_size: int = 10):\n        self.connection_string = connection_string\n        self.pool_size = pool_size\n        self._connection_pool = None\n    \n    async def initialize(self):\n        \"\"\"Initialize database connection pool for production use.\"\"\"\n        # In real implementation, this would create actual connection pool\n        self._connection_pool = f\"ConnectionPool({self.connection_string}, size={self.pool_size})\"\n        logging.info(f\"Database service initialized: {self._connection_pool}\")\n    \n    async def save_result(self, result_data: Dict[str, Any]) -> str:\n        \"\"\"Save agent result to production database with transaction safety.\"\"\"\n        # In production, this would use proper database transactions\n        result_id = str(uuid.uuid4())\n        logging.info(f\"Saved result {result_id} to database\")\n        return result_id\n    \n    async def get_result(self, result_id: str) -> Optional[Dict[str, Any]]:\n        \"\"\"Retrieve result from production database with error handling.\"\"\"\n        # Production implementation would include proper error handling\n        logging.info(f\"Retrieved result {result_id} from database\")\n        return {\"id\": result_id, \"status\": \"found\"}\n    \n    async def health_check(self) -> bool:\n        \"\"\"Monitor database connection health for production systems.\"\"\"\n        return self._connection_pool is not None\n```\n\n### Test Service Implementations\n\nTest implementations provide predictable behavior and call tracking for comprehensive testing without external dependencies.\n\n```python\n# Test database service with in-memory storage and call tracking\nclass TestDatabaseService:\n    \"\"\"Test database service with in-memory storage and comprehensive logging.\"\"\"\n    \n    def __init__(self):\n        self.data_store = {}  # In-memory storage for test data\n        self.call_log = []    # Track all method calls for verification\n    \n    async def initialize(self):\n        \"\"\"Initialize test database - always succeeds for testing.\"\"\"\n        logging.info(\"Test database service initialized\")\n    \n    async def save_result(self, result_data: Dict[str, Any]) -> str:\n        \"\"\"Save result to in-memory store with predictable IDs.\"\"\"\n        result_id = f\"test_{len(self.data_store)}\"\n        self.data_store[result_id] = result_data\n        self.call_log.append((\"save\", result_id, result_data))\n        return result_id\n    \n    async def get_result(self, result_id: str) -> Optional[Dict[str, Any]]:\n        \"\"\"Retrieve result from in-memory store with call logging.\"\"\"\n        self.call_log.append((\"get\", result_id))\n        return self.data_store.get(result_id)\n    \n    async def health_check(self) -> bool:\n        \"\"\"Test database is always healthy for consistent testing.\"\"\"\n        return True\n    \n    def get_call_log(self) -> List[tuple]:\n        \"\"\"Get complete log of service calls for test verification.\"\"\"\n        return self.call_log.copy()\n```\n\n### Dependency Injection Container\n\nThe dependency container manages service lifecycles, registration, and resolution with support for singletons and scoped services.\n\n```python\n# Advanced dependency injection container with lifecycle management\nclass DependencyContainer:\n    \"\"\"Enterprise-grade dependency injection container with full lifecycle support.\"\"\"\n    \n    def __init__(self):\n        self.services = {}              # Active service instances\n        self.factories = {}             # Service factory functions\n        self.singletons = {}           # Singleton service instances\n        self.scoped_services = {}      # Scoped service definitions\n        self.initialization_order = [] # Service initialization sequence\n    \n    def register_singleton(\n        self, \n        interface: Type, \n        implementation: Type, \n        *args, \n        **kwargs\n    ) -> None:\n        \"\"\"Register a singleton service that lives for the container lifetime.\"\"\"\n        self.factories[interface] = lambda: implementation(*args, **kwargs)\n        self.initialization_order.append(interface)\n    \n    async def get_service(self, interface: Type, scope: str = \"default\") -> Any:\n        \"\"\"Resolve service instance with proper initialization and lifecycle management.\"\"\"\n        \n        # Check existing singletons first for performance\n        if interface in self.singletons:\n            return self.singletons[interface]\n        \n        # Create and cache singleton instances\n        if interface in self.factories:\n            instance = self.factories[interface]()\n            if hasattr(instance, 'initialize'):\n                await instance.initialize()\n            self.singletons[interface] = instance\n            return instance\n        \n        raise ValueError(f\"No registration found for {interface}\")\n```\n\n---\n\n## Part 2: Scalability & Performance (25 minutes)\n\n### Production Agent Architecture\n\nüóÇÔ∏è **File**: `src/session5/production_agents.py` - Scalable agent implementations\n\nProduction PydanticAI applications require robust architecture patterns that handle concurrency, error recovery, and monitoring at scale.\n\n```python\n# Production-ready agent patterns and architectures\nimport asyncio\nfrom concurrent.futures import ThreadPoolExecutor\nfrom typing import Protocol, runtime_checkable\nfrom contextlib import asynccontextmanager\nimport logging\nfrom abc import ABC, abstractmethod\n\n# Configure production logging\nlogging.basicConfig(\n    level=logging.INFO,\n    format='%(asctime)s - %(name)s - %(levelname)s - %(message)s',\n    handlers=[\n        logging.StreamHandler(),\n        logging.FileHandler('agent_production.log')\n    ]\n)\n```\n\n### Agent Metrics and Monitoring\n\nComprehensive metrics tracking enables monitoring and optimization of agent performance in production environments.\n\n```python\nclass AgentMetrics(BaseModel):\n    \"\"\"Comprehensive agent metrics for monitoring.\"\"\"\n    \n    total_requests: int = 0\n    successful_requests: int = 0\n    failed_requests: int = 0\n    average_response_time_ms: float = 0.0\n    p95_response_time_ms: float = 0.0\n    p99_response_time_ms: float = 0.0\n    error_rate_percent: float = 0.0\n    last_request_timestamp: Optional[datetime] = None\n    uptime_seconds: float = 0.0\n    memory_usage_mb: float = 0.0\n    \n    @property\n    def success_rate_percent(self) -> float:\n        \"\"\"Calculate success rate percentage.\"\"\"\n        if self.total_requests == 0:\n            return 100.0\n        return (self.successful_requests / self.total_requests) * 100.0\n```\n\n### Production Agent Base Class\n\nThe production agent base class provides all necessary infrastructure for enterprise deployment including metrics, health checks, and error handling.\n\n```python\nclass ProductionAgentBase(ABC):\n    \"\"\"Abstract base class for production-ready agents.\"\"\"\n    \n    def __init__(self, name: str, config: Dict[str, Any] = None):\n        self.name = name\n        self.config = config or {}\n        self.logger = logging.getLogger(f\"{self.__class__.__name__}.{name}\")\n        self.metrics = AgentMetrics()\n        self.start_time = datetime.now(timezone.utc)\n        self._request_times: List[float] = []\n        self._executor = ThreadPoolExecutor(max_workers=4)\n        self._health_status = \"healthy\"\n        \n    @abstractmethod\n    async def _process_core_request(self, request: BaseModel) -> BaseModel:\n        \"\"\"Core request processing logic - must be implemented by subclasses.\"\"\"\n        pass\n```\n\n### Request Processing with Monitoring\n\nRequest processing includes comprehensive monitoring, error handling, and performance tracking for production reliability.\n\n```python\n    async def process_request(self, request: BaseModel) -> BaseModel:\n        \"\"\"Process request with full monitoring and error handling.\"\"\"\n        start_time = time.time()\n        self.metrics.total_requests += 1\n        \n        try:\n            # Update metrics\n            self.metrics.last_request_timestamp = datetime.now(timezone.utc)\n            \n            # Process the request\n            result = await self._process_core_request(request)\n            \n            # Track success\n            self.metrics.successful_requests += 1\n            self._health_status = \"healthy\"\n            \n            return result\n            \n        except Exception as e:\n            # Track failure\n            self.metrics.failed_requests += 1\n            self._health_status = \"degraded\"\n            self.logger.error(f\"Request processing failed: {e}\")\n            raise\n            \n        finally:\n            # Track timing\n            request_time = (time.time() - start_time) * 1000\n            self._request_times.append(request_time)\n            self._update_timing_metrics()\n```\n\n### Concurrent Request Processing\n\nProduction agents support concurrent request processing with proper resource management and backpressure handling.\n\n```python\n    async def process_batch(self, requests: List[BaseModel]) -> List[BaseModel]:\n        \"\"\"Process multiple requests concurrently with resource management.\"\"\"\n        \n        # Limit concurrent requests to prevent resource exhaustion\n        semaphore = asyncio.Semaphore(self.config.get('max_concurrent_requests', 10))\n        \n        async def process_with_semaphore(request):\n            async with semaphore:\n                return await self.process_request(request)\n        \n        # Execute all requests concurrently\n        tasks = [process_with_semaphore(req) for req in requests]\n        results = await asyncio.gather(*tasks, return_exceptions=True)\n        \n        # Separate successful results from exceptions\n        successful_results = []\n        for result in results:\n            if isinstance(result, Exception):\n                self.logger.error(f\"Batch processing error: {result}\")\n            else:\n                successful_results.append(result)\n        \n        return successful_results\n```\n\n### Health Monitoring and Circuit Breaker\n\nHealth monitoring and circuit breaker patterns prevent cascading failures in production environments.\n\n```python\n    async def health_check(self) -> Dict[str, Any]:\n        \"\"\"Comprehensive health check for monitoring systems.\"\"\"\n        uptime = (datetime.now(timezone.utc) - self.start_time).total_seconds()\n        self.metrics.uptime_seconds = uptime\n        \n        # Check memory usage\n        import psutil\n        process = psutil.Process()\n        memory_mb = process.memory_info().rss / 1024 / 1024\n        self.metrics.memory_usage_mb = memory_mb\n        \n        return {\n            \"status\": self._health_status,\n            \"uptime_seconds\": uptime,\n            \"memory_mb\": memory_mb,\n            \"success_rate\": self.metrics.success_rate_percent,\n            \"total_requests\": self.metrics.total_requests,\n            \"avg_response_time_ms\": self.metrics.average_response_time_ms\n        }\n```\n\n---\n\n## Part 3: Security & Compliance (20 minutes)\n\n### Enterprise Security Patterns\n\nüóÇÔ∏è **File**: `src/session5/security.py` - Enterprise security implementations\n\nEnterprise PydanticAI applications require comprehensive security patterns including authentication, authorization, data privacy, and audit logging.\n\n```python\n# Enterprise security patterns for PydanticAI\nimport jwt\nimport hashlib\nimport secrets\nfrom typing import List, Optional, Dict, Any\nfrom datetime import datetime, timedelta, timezone\nfrom pydantic import BaseModel, Field\nimport logging\n\nclass SecurityConfig(BaseModel):\n    \"\"\"Security configuration for enterprise deployments.\"\"\"\n    \n    jwt_secret_key: str = Field(..., min_length=32)\n    jwt_expiration_hours: int = Field(default=24, ge=1, le=168)  # 1 hour to 1 week\n    api_rate_limit_per_minute: int = Field(default=100, ge=1)\n    enable_audit_logging: bool = Field(default=True)\n    allowed_origins: List[str] = Field(default_factory=list)\n    require_https: bool = Field(default=True)\n```\n\n### Authentication and Authorization\n\nComprehensive authentication and authorization system for enterprise agent access control.\n\n```python\nclass UserRole(str, Enum):\n    \"\"\"User roles for role-based access control.\"\"\"\n    ADMIN = \"admin\"\n    AGENT_OPERATOR = \"agent_operator\"\n    DATA_ANALYST = \"data_analyst\"\n    READ_ONLY = \"read_only\"\n\nclass AuthenticationService:\n    \"\"\"Enterprise authentication service with JWT tokens.\"\"\"\n    \n    def __init__(self, config: SecurityConfig):\n        self.config = config\n        self.logger = logging.getLogger(__name__)\n    \n    def create_access_token(self, user_id: str, roles: List[UserRole]) -> str:\n        \"\"\"Create JWT access token with user information and roles.\"\"\"\n        now = datetime.now(timezone.utc)\n        payload = {\n            \"user_id\": user_id,\n            \"roles\": [role.value for role in roles],\n            \"iat\": now,\n            \"exp\": now + timedelta(hours=self.config.jwt_expiration_hours),\n            \"iss\": \"pydantic-ai-enterprise\"\n        }\n        \n        token = jwt.encode(payload, self.config.jwt_secret_key, algorithm=\"HS256\")\n        self.logger.info(f\"Created access token for user {user_id}\")\n        return token\n    \n    def verify_token(self, token: str) -> Optional[Dict[str, Any]]:\n        \"\"\"Verify JWT token and return user information.\"\"\"\n        try:\n            payload = jwt.decode(\n                token, \n                self.config.jwt_secret_key, \n                algorithms=[\"HS256\"],\n                options={\"verify_exp\": True}\n            )\n            return payload\n        except jwt.ExpiredSignatureError:\n            self.logger.warning(\"Token verification failed: expired\")\n            return None\n        except jwt.InvalidTokenError:\n            self.logger.warning(\"Token verification failed: invalid\")\n            return None\n```\n\n### Data Privacy and Compliance\n\nData privacy patterns ensure compliance with regulations like GDPR, HIPAA, and other enterprise requirements.\n\n```python\nclass DataPrivacyService:\n    \"\"\"Data privacy and compliance service for sensitive data handling.\"\"\"\n    \n    def __init__(self, encryption_key: str):\n        self.encryption_key = encryption_key.encode()\n        self.logger = logging.getLogger(__name__)\n    \n    def anonymize_user_data(self, data: Dict[str, Any]) -> Dict[str, Any]:\n        \"\"\"Anonymize sensitive user data while preserving utility.\"\"\"\n        anonymized = data.copy()\n        \n        # Hash personally identifiable information\n        if 'email' in anonymized:\n            anonymized['email_hash'] = self._hash_pii(anonymized.pop('email'))\n        \n        if 'user_id' in anonymized:\n            anonymized['user_hash'] = self._hash_pii(anonymized.pop('user_id'))\n        \n        # Remove sensitive fields\n        sensitive_fields = ['ssn', 'phone', 'address', 'credit_card']\n        for field in sensitive_fields:\n            if field in anonymized:\n                del anonymized[field]\n        \n        return anonymized\n    \n    def _hash_pii(self, data: str) -> str:\n        \"\"\"Hash personally identifiable information for anonymization.\"\"\"\n        # Use salt for additional security\n        salt = b\"pydantic_ai_salt\"\n        return hashlib.sha256(salt + data.encode()).hexdigest()[:16]\n```\n\n### Audit Logging System\n\nComprehensive audit logging tracks all agent operations for compliance and security monitoring.\n\n```python\nclass AuditLogger:\n    \"\"\"Enterprise audit logging for compliance and security monitoring.\"\"\"\n    \n    def __init__(self, config: SecurityConfig):\n        self.config = config\n        self.audit_logger = logging.getLogger(\"audit\")\n        \n        # Configure audit-specific handler\n        audit_handler = logging.FileHandler(\"audit.log\")\n        audit_formatter = logging.Formatter(\n            '%(asctime)s - AUDIT - %(levelname)s - %(message)s'\n        )\n        audit_handler.setFormatter(audit_formatter)\n        self.audit_logger.addHandler(audit_handler)\n        self.audit_logger.setLevel(logging.INFO)\n    \n    def log_agent_request(\n        self, \n        user_id: str, \n        agent_name: str, \n        request_data: Dict[str, Any],\n        result: Optional[Dict[str, Any]] = None,\n        error: Optional[str] = None\n    ):\n        \"\"\"Log agent request for audit trail.\"\"\"\n        if not self.config.enable_audit_logging:\n            return\n        \n        audit_entry = {\n            \"timestamp\": datetime.now(timezone.utc).isoformat(),\n            \"event_type\": \"agent_request\",\n            \"user_id\": user_id,\n            \"agent_name\": agent_name,\n            \"request_size_bytes\": len(str(request_data)),\n            \"success\": error is None,\n            \"error_message\": error\n        }\n        \n        self.audit_logger.info(f\"AGENT_REQUEST: {audit_entry}\")\n```\n\n---\n\n## üéØ Module Summary\n\nYou've now mastered enterprise PydanticAI patterns, including:\n\n‚úÖ **Dependency Injection**: Built clean, testable architecture with service protocols  \n‚úÖ **Production Scalability**: Implemented monitoring, metrics, and concurrent processing  \n‚úÖ **Enterprise Security**: Created authentication, authorization, and compliance systems  \n‚úÖ **Audit & Monitoring**: Built comprehensive logging and health monitoring\n\n### Next Steps\n- **Continue to Module C**: [Custom Validation Systems](Session5_ModuleC_Custom_Validation_Systems.md) for specialized validation patterns\n- **Continue to Module D**: [Testing & Benchmarking](Session5_ModuleD_Testing_Benchmarking.md) for comprehensive testing strategies\n- **Return to Core**: [Session 5 Main](Session5_PydanticAI_Type_Safe_Agents.md)\n- **Advance to Session 6**: [Atomic Agents](Session6_Atomic_Agents_Modular_Architecture.md)\n\n---\n\n**üóÇÔ∏è Source Files for Module B:**\n- `src/session5/dependency_injection.py` - Complete DI system\n- }

 EXTERNAL_SERVICE = \"external_service\"\n    DATA_CORRUPTION = \"data_corruption\"\n    CONFIGURATION = \"configuration\"\n    UNKNOWN = \"unknown\"\n```\n\n### Comprehensive Error Context\n\nThe \"\"\"Comprehensive error context for debugging and monitoring.\"\"\"\n    error_id: str = field(default_factory=lambda: str(uuid.uuid4()))\n    timestamp: datetime = field(default_factory=lambda: traceback.format_exc()\n        self.__cause__ = cause\n\nclass ValidationAgentError(AgentError):\n    \"\"\"Error specific to validation failures.\"\"\"\n    \n    def __init__(self, message: str,
